data.title: 6ix9ine Says Lil Baby’s “The Bigger Picture” Deserved to Be No. 1
meta_keywords: 6ix9ine says lil baby's the bigger picture deserved to be no.1
6ix9ine says lil baby should be no. 1
lil baby 6ix9ine trollz the bigger picture
the bigger picture no. 3 billboard hot 100
data.meta_description: 6ix9ine says he thinks Lil Baby's The Bigger Picture should have gotten the No. 1 spot on the Billboard Hot 100.
data.text:
Despite celebrating his first No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100, 6ix9ine says somebody else may have deserved the crown more than himself and Nicki Minaj.

On Monday afternoon (June 22), after securing the No. 1 spot on the Billboard Hot 100, for his song "Trollz" with Nicki Minaj, 6ix9ine shared a comment on social media, saying Lil Baby deserved to be in the No. 1 spot on the chart. "Lil Baby deserved it not gonna lie BUT I waited on this forever," Tekashi wrote on Instagram.

Tekashi is referring to Baby's "The Bigger Picture." The track is the 25-year-old rapper's ode to the Black Lives Matter movement that honors the lives of those who passed away as a result of police brutality.

"The Bigger Picture" debuted at the third spot on the Hot 100 chart this week behind the 6ix9ine's "Trollz," and DaBaby and Roddy Ricch's "Rockstar." The Charlotte rapper and Roddy's collab held the No. 1 position on the chart the week before.

Earlier today, the "Gooba" rapper saw his second single since being released from federal prison to home confinement catapult to the top of the charts. After being notified of the victory, 6ix9ine hopped on Instagram to brag about how he could not be stopped.

"Didn't I tell you, nigga?," Tekashi began in the celebratory clip. "I can't be stopped, nigga. Didn't I tell you? And we got blackballed. You can't blackball me. Listen, I'm telling you, I'm going on a seven-day rant. You better unfollow me ’cause I'm going on a seven-day rant.

"Trollz" is the third single that 6ix9ine has had debut in the top 10 on the Billboard Hot 100.
